metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: You can loop through the array elements with the for loop, and use the Length property to specify how many times the loop should run.
content.html: You can loop through the array elements with the for loop, and use the Length property to specify how many times the loop should run.

content.text: The following example outputs all elements in the cars array:
content.html: The following example outputs all elements in the cars array:

content.code:
string
[
]
cars
=

{
"Volvo"
,

"BMW"
,

"Ford"
,

"Mazda"
}
;


for

(
int
i
=

0
;
i
<
cars
.
Length
;
i
++
)


{

Console
.
WriteLine
(
cars
[
i
]
)
;


}
content.code_html:
string[] cars = {"Volvo", "BMW", "Ford", "Mazda"};
for (int i = 0; i < cars.Length; i++) 
{
  Console.WriteLine(cars[i]);
}

content.text: There is also a foreach loop, which is used exclusively to loop through elements in an array :
content.html: There is also a foreach loop, which is used exclusively to loop through elements in an array:

content.code_html:
foreach (type variableName in arrayName) 
{
  // code block to be executed
}

content.text: The following example outputs all elements in the cars array, using a foreach loop:
content.html: The following example outputs all elements in the cars array, using a foreach loop:

content.code:
string
[
]
cars
=

{
"Volvo"
,

"BMW"
,

"Ford"
,

"Mazda"
}
;


foreach

(
string
i
in
cars
)


{

Console
.
WriteLine
(
i
)
;


}
content.code_html:
string[] cars = {"Volvo", "BMW", "Ford", "Mazda"};
foreach (string i in cars) 
{
  Console.WriteLine(i);
}

content.text: The example above can be read like this: for each string element (called i - as in i ndex) in cars , print out the value of i .
content.html: The example above can be read like this: for each string element (called i - as in index) in cars, print out the value of i.

content.text: If you compare the for loop and foreach loop, you will see that the foreach method is easier to write, it does not require a counter (using the Length property), and it is more readable.
content.html: If you compare the for loop and foreach loop, you will see that the foreach method is easier to write, it does not require a counter (using the Length property), and it is more readable.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which loop is used in C# to iterate through each element in an array without requiring a counter?
content.html: Which loop is used in C# to iterate through each element in an array without requiring a counter?
